abstract: Fox’s “Are You Smarter Than a Fifth Grader?” delivered its highest ratings in 10 months on Thursday, lifting the network to a rare No. 1 finish on the night among adults 18 to 49. The quiz show with Jeff Foxworthy as host earned 11.5 million viewers, according to Nielsen’s estimates, leading the 8 p.m. time slot ahead of ABC’s “Ugly Betty” (9.5 million) and repeats on CBS and NBC.
lead_paragraph: Fox’s “Are You Smarter Than a Fifth Grader?” delivered its highest ratings in 10 months on Thursday, lifting the network to a rare No. 1 finish on the night among adults 18 to 49. The quiz show with Jeff Foxworthy as host earned 11.5 million viewers, according to Nielsen’s estimates, leading the 8 p.m. time slot ahead of ABC’s “Ugly Betty” (9.5 million) and repeats on CBS and NBC.

headline.main: A Rare Thursday Win For Fox
